ARABIC: إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا فِىٓ أَعْنَٰقِهِمْ أَغْلَٰلًا فَهِىَ إِلَى ٱلْأَذْقَانِ فَهُم مُّقْمَحُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We have put iron collars round their necks reaching up to the chin, so that their heads are forced back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We will certainly put iron collars on their heel's which will come up to their chins, so that they will not be able to raise their heads.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We have put fetters around their necks which reach up to their chins so that they are standing with their heads upright,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We have enchained their necks up to their chins. Thus, they cannot bend their heads (to find their way).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: We have indeed put shackles around their necks reaching up to the chins, so they remain facing upwards.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, We have put on their necks iron collars reaching to the chins, so that their heads are raised up.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely We have placed chains on their necks, and these reach up to their chins, so they have their heads raised aloft.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Surely We have put on their necks fetters up to the chin, so their heads are raised;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! We have put on their necks carcans reaching unto the chins, so that they are made stiff-necked.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We have put yokes round their necks right up to their chins, so that they cannot bow their heads
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily We have placed on their necks shackles which are up to the chins; so that their heads are forced up.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed We have put iron collars around their necks, which are up to the chins, so their heads are upturned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: We have put yokes round their necks right up to their chins, so that their heads are forced up (and they cannot see).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily! We have put on their necks iron collars reaching to chins, so that their heads are forced up.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We have bound their necks with fetters up to their chin, so that their heads are raised and cannot be lowered.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We placed shackles around their necks, up to their chins, so they are stiff-necked.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, We have put shackles on their necks, and they are to their chins, so they are with heads [kept] aloft.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [36:8] Indeed We have put fetters around their necks, to bind to them their hands (because ghull [is a fetter that] shackles the hands to the neck), such that they, the hands, are, bound, up to the chins (adhqān is the plural of dhaqan, which is where the two sides of the beard meet) so that their heads are upturned, they are unable to lower them: this [statement] is figurative and is meant to indicate their inability to yield to faith or to lower their heads to it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! we have put on their necks) and hands (carcans) of iron (reaching unto the chins, so that they are made stiff necked) it is also said that this means: We pulled their hands to their chins when they were about to stone the Prophet (pbuh) while he was praying. Therefore, they are chained and prevented from all good.
